channel.title: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop
channel.description: How do you do it? Ive done it on a lan computer, it worked fine. I did the same exact thing on my laptop, and it didn't work. I double checked, and everything was the same exact thing, all programs download. Do you have an idea how it could work? When I run the server, I start it, it works. I start no-ip, it works, just like on the lan computer. I tried to log on, it didnt work. I shut the lan cpu off, it didn't work. Whats wrong here?

item.title: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

I did, but can you help? I just tried on my other lan cpu, and the server only seems to work on only one compiter, the one I started off with. I dont know why.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop

item.title: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

I think I know why, I deleted svchost and that turns off the firewall and everything added, ill try again then edit this post.
EDIT: Not working. My server is darkrealm.sytes.net, could you try and see if it works?

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop

item.title: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Why would it matter if it was a laptop/wireless? It uses the internet the same does it not? It has java? Then it should work.

Read full topic

I host servers on my laptop all the time and it works perfectly

item.title: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

Hmm… could you see if darkrealm.sytes.net works? I tried it on the lan cpu when I was running the server, it worked.I tried both on the lan and it worked, so I dont know why. It uses Silab, so dont try to but the new items.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop

item.title: Making a Private Server on a Wireless Laptop
item.dc:creator: @pimpownage pimpownage
item.description:
@pimpownage wrote:

you can’t log in with the ip of the server, you have to log in with 0.0.0.0 and other ppl log in with like ummm… example.no-ip.biz. is that what you mean?
because i made a few servers on my laptop which i am using now, works fine for me.

Read full topic
